title: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't perform the Find operation on Mac OS X
description:
When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform the Find operation. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit->Find/Replace).
2) Type a search term into the text box.
3) Press the Enter/Return key.

Expected Results: The Find operation should be performed, similar to clicking the 'Find' button which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog.

Actual Results: Nothing happens when the Enter/Return key is pressed.
OB: The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) does not perform the Find operation when pressed.
EB: The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) does not perform the Find operation when pressed.
SR: The issue should be fixed so that pressing the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X 10.2.6 with Eclipse 3.0 M2 (build id: 200307181617) performs the Find operation as expected.
